relation: Get a site added back to Google
Get a page or site removed from Google
Report a copyright violation or the misuse of your content
Tell Google to crawl your site more slowly
Tell Google that your content is mistakenly being filtered by SafeSearch

If your site was distributing malware, and is now clean, request a malware review. If your site was showing spam, but is now clean, submit a reconsideration request. If your site was in violation of the Webmaster Guidelines, but is now clean, submit a reconsideration request. If you asked for a page or site to be removed from Google, but you've changed your mind, request reinclusion of the content. If you received a phishing warning but believe that it's actually a legitimate page, report an incorrect phishing warning.
Request a change in crawl rate.
pageTitle: Get additional support - Search Console Help
textBeforeTable: Contact Google Get your site added back to Google Reporting spam Removing content from Google If your site isn't performing well in search Webmasters FAQ Fix your issue now The following articles answer the most common questions we get from webmasters. Post your question Post your question to the Help Forum, where other webmasters and Googlers are able to help you. Our goal is to help you get the fastest answer to your question. Here's how you can find what you're looking for: Get additional support Help forumForum Search Console Search Console Help Search Console Help
textAfterTable: If your issue is not covered by any of the options above, please post your question in the Webmaster Help Forum. Still can't get an answer? Try the Webmaster Troubleshooter.
